doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Yaddahige Chandrarathne, Vs The Hon. Attorney General, before Hon. Amal Ranaraja, J.
latest_doc_d.parties: Yaddahige Chandrarathne, Vs The Hon. Attorney General,
latest_doc_d.keywords: Suspension of sentences in light of factors such as the nature of the offence, the offender’s culpability, previous character, remorse and mitigating circumstances. Scope for a non-custodial sentence.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Sections 298 and 328 of the Penal Code, Section 303 of the Criminal Procedure Code Act No. 15 of 1979
